lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The escape pod bobs in warm, tropical water.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Waves push it toward a sandy beach. Palm trees. Blue sky. Wreckage everywhere.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: LAND HO! Welcome to Carl's Island Paradise!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Carl is already standing on the beach. He's wearing a captain's hat. He has been here for weeks.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: How are you ALREADY HERE?!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I took the express route! Built a raft from the escape pod wreckage. Very resourceful.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I commandeered that ship over there. The S.S. Carl!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: That's a GHOST SHIP, Carl. It looks like it's been here for decades.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The previous crew had to leave suddenly. Very, very suddenly.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Something that might have been a parrot squawks from the ship's mast. It's definitely not a parrot.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The dock creaks underfoot. The ghost ship looms above.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The cargo hold is open. Those crates... they're leaking.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, what's in the cargo?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Supplies! For my arts and crafts projects!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I've been working on a very special collection. Island art, Paul!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The crates are labeled 'FRAGILE — HUMAN REMAINS.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Well, they ARE fragile. You should see what happens when you drop them.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A captain's logbook sits on a barrel near the gangplank.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The logbook is written in Carl's unmistakable hoofwriting.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 1: Found a ship! Very roomy. The crew was welcoming.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 3: The crew is less welcoming now. But the plank is very efficient.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 7: Crew complement optimized. I'm the whole crew now! Lean management!'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 14: Found an island! Perfect for my collection. Built a cave.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: He didn't FIND a cave. He BUILT one. What's he keeping in there?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The jungle path is marked with... trail markers.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Those aren't sticks. Those are BONES.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Arranged like arrows. Pointing deeper into the jungle.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The craftsmanship is... disturbingly familiar.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I made a nature trail! Eco-tourism, Paul!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: All organic, locally sourced materials! Very sustainable.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, those are HUMAN FEMURS.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Very durable! Great load-bearing capacity. The structural integrity is superb.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Something crunches underfoot. It's better not to look down.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The cave is lit by makeshift torches. The walls glitter.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: At first glance, it looks like a treasure hoard. Piles reaching the ceiling.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: This isn't gold. This isn't... this isn't treasure.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh god. Is that a NECKLACE? What is it made from?!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: My treasure room! Hand-curated over months!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: That necklace is custom-made. One of a kind! Like its previous owner.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I can't even describe what I'm looking at.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I call it 'artisanal.' Very exclusive. Limited edition.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: VERY limited. You could say the edition has been... discontinued.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A compass sits on a stone pedestal. Its needle spins, then locks pointing directly at Carl.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The captain's quarters are lavishly decorated. In Carl's unique style.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl's diary. Hundreds of pages.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: 'Day 47: The crew appreciated today's team-building exercise.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: 'Day 48: Crew size reduced for efficiency. Lean management!'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: 'Day 67: Island fully landscaped. Used all available resources.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: There's a map. X marks... there are so many Xs, Carl.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Each X is a buried treasure! Well, buried SOMETHING.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The island's soil is very fertile now. Very... enriched.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I need to get off this island. The lighthouse. I can signal for help.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: From the crow's nest, the entire island stretches below.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And now the full scope of Carl's work is visible.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The... the entire island. Every path, every clearing.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: He's decorated EVERYTHING. With PARTS.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The lighthouse. I can see it from here. That's my way out.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Beautiful view, isn't it? I call it 'Island of a Thousand Pieces.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Each piece tells a story! A very short story, admittedly.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I'm going to the lighthouse. Don't follow me.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The path to the lighthouse is open! I cleared it myself! Very hospitable.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The lighthouse tower rises above the island. The beacon still works.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: If I can get this light working, someone will see it. Someone will come.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul! You found my lighthouse! I've been meaning to redecorate it.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Stay BACK, Carl. I'm turning on the signal.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Ooh, a light show! Everyone loves a light show! Can I help?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The switch is thrown. The beacon blazes to life.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The beam cuts through the darkness. And something on the horizon moves.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Look, Paul! Visitors! I should prepare a welcome feast!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Rescue? Or something Carl invited? Either way... this chapter is over.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: A captain's logbook. In Carl's hoofwriting. This should be... illuminating.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The entries start cheerful and get progressively darker. Classic Carl.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: By Day 30, he's stopped counting crew members and started counting 'materials.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: A necklace made from... I don't want to identify these materials.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Each bead is carved from... bone. Human bone. With tiny faces etched into them.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl put FACES on them. He's getting more artistic and it's getting WORSE.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: This compass... the needle keeps pointing at Carl. No matter which way I turn.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: North, south, east, west — it doesn't matter. The needle always points to Carl.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: On the back is engraved: 'So you can always find me! — C.' Terrifying.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl's personal Jolly Roger. His face where the skull should be. Somehow that's worse.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: A pirate flag with Carl's smiling face. The crossbones underneath are disturbingly realistic.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: At the bottom in tiny letters: 'Handmade with love and genuine materials.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Daylight feels wrong after the cave. Too bright. Too normal.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I can't unsee what was in there. The necklaces. The carvings.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You barely saw the collection! There are HUNDREDS of pieces deeper in!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl... this island. What have you done to this place?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: There are bones everywhere. Arranged like decorations.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Human femurs. Used as TRAIL MARKERS. That is not appropriate signage, Carl.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: There are regulations. Standards. You can't just use people as infrastructure.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: But they're so durable! And they glow in the dark!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: That... that is not a selling point. I need to find the lighthouse.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The cave, Carl. Your 'treasure room.' That is not treasure.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Those necklaces. Those carvings. Each one was a person.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: You catalogued them. With LABELS.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Museum-quality curation, Paul! You should appreciate the organizational effort.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I appreciate NOTHING about this. I need to signal for rescue.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The lighthouse. If I can reach it, I can signal for help.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Someone sane. Someone who doesn't make jewelry from people.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: But Paul! We're having such a nice vacation!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: This is not a vacation. This is a crime scene the size of an island.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I can't be near you right now, Carl.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I'm going to find the lighthouse. And then I'm going to leave. Forever.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Ahoy, Paul! Welcome to Carl's Island Paradise!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I'm Captain Carl now. The hat makes it official.

options.text: What happened to the ship's crew?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: They walked the plank! It's a pirate tradition!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Some of them walked voluntarily. Others needed... encouragement.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: You made people walk the plank. Into the OCEAN.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Well, not ALL of them made it to the ocean. Some of them are the trail markers now.

options.text: You used them as TRAIL MARKERS?!
I don't want to hear any more.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Eco-friendly navigation! Zero carbon footprint!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Well, SOME footprints. But they're not going anywhere.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I have never been more horrified. And that's saying something at this point.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: My collection! I've been curating it for months!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Each piece is unique. Handcrafted. From locally-sourced materials.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Stop saying 'locally-sourced.' I know what you mean by that.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You should visit! It's like a museum. A very exclusive, private museum.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The necklaces are my best work. Very delicate craftsmanship.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: But you just got here! I have so much to show you!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The lighthouse might work, if you're really set on leaving.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: But you should see the crow's nest first! The view is to DIE for!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Please stop saying things are 'to die for.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: It's just an expression, Paul! A very accurate expression!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Okay! I'll be on the ship if you need me!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I'm working on a new recipe. Island fusion cuisine!

barrel.prompt: A weathered ship barrel, lid nailed shut with rusted iron. Liquid sloshes inside.
carl: My fermentation project! Give it another week and it'll be ready for the luau!
That one's labeled 'Do Not Open Until Christmas.' I'm very patient when it comes to aging things.
paul: A barrel from the ship. The lid is nailed shut. Something inside is sloshing. I'm not opening it.
There's a smell coming from this barrel that I've unfortunately learned to recognize.
horror: The barrel pulses slightly, as if something inside is still settling.

crate.prompt: A shipping crate from the S.S. Carl. Handwritten labels in uneven hoofwriting.
carl: Supplies! I organized everything by category. Very efficient packing!
That one's my arts and crafts materials. Organic, free-range, ethically... well, just organic.
paul: Shipping crate from the S.S. Carl. Labeled 'FRAGILE — SUPPLIES.' The label is handwritten.
The manifest stapled to this crate lists contents that should never be listed on a manifest.
horror: The crate's wood grain has warped into patterns that almost look like screaming faces.

rock.prompt: A large flat rock with deep carvings scratched into its surface.
carl: My scoreboard! I keep track of all my island activities! Very organized!
I ran out of room on one side so I started a second column. Productivity!
paul: A large rock. Something is carved into it. It looks like a tally mark system. There are a LOT of marks.
The tally marks are grouped in fives. There are over forty groups. That's over two hundred...
horror: Some of the tally marks appear to have been scratched not by hooves, but by fingernails.

campfire.prompt: A campfire pit surrounded by stones. The ashes are still warm.
carl: S'mores night! Every Tuesday! The secret ingredient is in the marinade!
I hosted a cookout for the whole crew! Well, FOR the whole crew might be the wrong preposition.
paul: A campfire pit. The ashes are still warm. The smell is... not wood smoke.
There are bones in the ash. I'm going to tell myself they're from a fish. A very large, bipedal fish.
horror: The embers briefly rearrange into a grinning face before collapsing back to ash.

sign.prompt: A hand-painted wooden sign staked into the sand.
carl: I made that sign myself! The paint is homemade too! Very resourceful!
I update the population count every week! It's a running tally. Emphasis on running.
paul: 'Welcome to Carl's Island Paradise! Population: Varies.' That's ominous.
Someone crossed out the original population number. Multiple times. Each revision is lower.
horror: The sign's paint is flaking, revealing older text beneath: 'HELP US.'

chest.prompt: An ornate treasure chest with Carl's initials branded into the lid.
carl: My personal trophy chest! Each item has sentimental value! And dental records!
I keep the really special pieces in here. Collector's editions, you might say.
paul: A treasure chest. The 'treasures' inside are not gold or jewels. They're personal effects. Wallets. Watches. Rings.
Each item in this chest has a tiny label with a name and date. Carl keeps meticulous records of his atrocities.
horror: The chest's lock clicks open on its own, as if eager to show you what's inside.

desk.prompt: A heavy wooden desk covered in maps, charts, and Carl's handwritten notes.
carl: My command center! Every great captain needs a desk! Mine has built-in cup holders!
I've mapped the entire island! Every path, every landmark, every... deposit site.
paul: Carl's desk. Covered in nautical charts annotated with his hoofwriting. The margin notes are harrowing.
There's a 'To Do' list pinned to the desk. Every item is crossed off. I don't want to read what they were.
horror: A drawer slides open by itself, revealing a half-finished letter that begins 'Dear Next Visitor.'

lamp.prompt: An oil lamp with a flickering flame. The glass is stained an unusual color.
carl: Mood lighting! Ambiance is important for island living, Paul!
I rendered the oil myself! Very sustainable! The previous owners had no use for it anymore.
paul: This lamp oil has an unusual color. And viscosity. I'm choosing not to think about the chemistry.
The flame flickers in patterns that almost look deliberate. Like a signal no one should answer.
horror: The lamp's flame burns a sickly green for a moment, illuminating stains on the wall that weren't visible before.

chair.prompt: A captain's chair, ornately carved and bolted to the floor.
carl: The captain's throne! I added the armrests myself! Very ergonomic bone structure!
Sit down, make yourself at home! The cushion is genuine... leather. Definitely leather.
paul: This chair is bolted to the floor. The armrests have scratch marks on the inside. Like someone was gripping them in terror.
The upholstery on this chair is handmade. The stitching pattern matches Carl's other 'crafts.'
horror: The chair creaks under no weight, as though remembering everyone who last sat in it.

dead_plant.prompt: A wilted tropical plant in a cracked pot. The soil is an unusual dark red.
carl: My garden! I have a green thumb! Well, it's green NOW. It wasn't always.
I use a special fertilizer! The plants grow SO fast! Very nutrient-rich soil!
paul: This plant is dead despite growing in soil that is clearly... enriched. Even the plants reject Carl's gardening methods.
The soil in this pot is the wrong color. And the wrong consistency. Nothing should grow in this.
horror: A single new leaf sprouts from the dead plant as you watch. It's the color of a bruise.

cannon.prompt: A ship's cannon aimed out to sea. Recently fired, judging by the residue.
carl: My welcome cannon! I fire it whenever new visitors arrive! Very festive!
The aim is a little off. I was trying to hit the reef but I keep hitting the escape boats instead. Oopsie!
paul: This cannon has been fired recently. And frequently. The barrel is practically smooth from use.
There are notches carved into the cannon's base. One for each... I need to stop counting things on this island.
horror: The cannon is warm to the touch, though no one has been near it. It's aimed at the only route off the island.

grass_patch.prompt: A patch of unusually lush, green grass. Greener than anything else on the island.
carl: My lawn! I'm very proud of the landscaping! The secret is what's underneath!
I composted very thoroughly in this area! The grass just LOVES it!
paul: This grass is impossibly green. Lush. Healthy. Whatever is decomposing underneath must be... substantial.
The ground here is soft and slightly raised. Like a mound. I know what mounds like this usually are.
horror: Your foot sinks an inch into the soft earth. Something underneath shifts.

dock_platform.prompt: The main dock platform extending over dark water. Planks are stained and warped.
carl: The welcome dock! I built it myself! Well, the crew built it. Before the restructuring.
Every plank tells a story! Some of them are even true!
paul: The dock planks are stained with something that isn't seawater. The stains lead to the edge and stop.
This is where the plank was. THE plank. Carl's 'team-building exercise.' The wood is worn smooth from use.
horror: Bubbles rise from the dark water beneath the dock. Too many bubbles. Too regularly spaced.

anchor.prompt: The ship's anchor, massive and rusted, wrapped in chains on the dock.
carl: My anchor! I decorated it! See the little carvings? Each one is a portrait of a crew member!
It's heavier than it looks! I had to add extra chain. For... anchoring purposes.
paul: The anchor chain has extra lengths of chain wrapped around it. Not for the anchor. For... other things.
There are scratches at the waterline where the chain meets the dock. Like something was dragged. Repeatedly.
horror: The anchor chain rattles softly on its own. From below the waterline, something tugs back.

carl: Beautiful day for the beach! I even raked the sand! Had to pick out a few things first, but it's pristine now!
The seashells here are amazing! Some of them aren't seashells but they're SHAPED like seashells!
I set up a volleyball net! Well, a net. It's made from the ship's rigging. And some other fibers I had lying around.
paul: The sand is warm. Too warm in patches. Like something underneath is still... generating heat.
Every few minutes a wave deposits something on the shore that definitely didn't come from the ocean floor.
This would be a beautiful beach if I didn't know what was buried under every single sand dune.

carl: The S.S. Carl is looking beautiful today! I gave her a fresh coat of paint! The paint is homemade!
I love the sound of the ship creaking! It's like she's talking to me! She says 'Carl, you're a great captain!'
Did you know this dock can hold up to fifty people? Well, it USED to hold fifty people. Now it holds fewer.
paul: The ghost ship's portholes are dark but I keep seeing movement. There's supposed to be no one on board.
Water laps against the hull and the sound echoes wrong. Like the ship is hollow. Or full of something that absorbs sound.
The gangplank has a groove worn into it. Like a track. Like something was rolled down it. Over and over.

carl: Nature walk! I labeled all the species! Well, the species of TREES. The other labels are for different things.
I cleared this path myself! It took a lot of elbow grease! And other types of grease I had available!
The jungle is so alive! Things growing everywhere! Especially where I did the composting!
paul: The bone trail markers get more elaborate the deeper you go. He's improving his craft. That's the worst part.
Something is following us through the undergrowth. It sounds too heavy for any animal that should be on this island.
The air smells sweet here. Cloyingly sweet. I've learned that sweetness in Carl's vicinity is never a good sign.

carl: Welcome to the gallery! I'm thinking of doing a grand opening! With refreshments! Guess the recipe!
This is my favorite room! I spend hours in here just admiring my work! Art appreciates over time, Paul!
I'm running out of display space! I might need to expand! The island has plenty of raw materials!
paul: The walls are lined with shelves. Each shelf is organized. Labeled. Categorized. He turned horror into a filing system.
My eyes have adjusted to the torchlight. I wish they hadn't. I could see less before. Less was better.
Every piece in this collection was a person. With a life. And Carl turned them into a curio cabinet.

carl: Mi casa es su casa! I redecorated! The previous captain had NO taste! Very drab. No personality.
I keep all my planning materials here! Charts, schedules, ingredient lists! Very organized!
The bed is custom-made! The frame is hand-carved! From a very specific type of... driftwood. Definitely driftwood.
paul: Carl's quarters are immaculate. He's a psychopath with a flair for interior design. Somehow that makes it worse.
There are plans pinned to every wall. Blueprints for things that should never be blueprinted.
A mirror on the wall is cracked. In the cracks, if you look at the right angle, you can see the old captain's face.

carl: Best seat in the house! You can see the whole island! Every project, every installation, every buried thing!
I come up here to plan! The bird's-eye view really helps with spatial organization of my activities!
Look! You can see the beach, the cave, the lighthouse! And all the spots where the soil is freshly turned!
paul: From up here the scope is undeniable. Every clearing, every path — it's all one giant monument to Carl's madness.
I can count at least thirty patches of disturbed earth from here. Thirty. And those are just the ones I can see.
The wind carries sounds from every corner of the island up here. None of them are sounds I want to hear.

carl: The lighthouse! Great for parties! The beam reaches for MILES! It's like a disco ball but for the whole ocean!
I was going to convert this into a gift shop! 'Carl's Island Souvenirs!' Handmade goods!
The light still works! I maintained it! In case anyone wanted to visit! I love visitors, Paul!
paul: The lighthouse still works. If I can get a signal out, someone will come. Someone has to come.
This is the highest point on the island. The farthest from Carl's cave. That alone makes it the safest place here.
There's a logbook from the original lighthouse keeper. The last entry just says 'The llama is here.' Then nothing.

carl: Back for more sun! I should set up a tiki bar! I've been experimenting with tropical drinks! The garnishes are unique!
Oh good, you're back! I buried something special near the tide line! A surprise for later!
paul: The tide came in while I was gone. It rearranged what was on the shore. There are new things exposed now.
I thought leaving and coming back would make this beach seem normal. It did not.

carl: Welcome back aboard! I've been organizing the cargo hold! Everything is sorted by size and... freshness!
The ship missed you! Well, I missed you! The ship doesn't have feelings! Probably!
paul: Something changed on the dock since I was last here. There are fewer crates. But the remaining ones are heavier.
The ghost ship has settled lower in the water. Like it's taken on new weight.

carl: Back for another viewing! I added new pieces since you were last here! The collection grows daily!
I rearranged the exhibits! New layout! The gift shop is almost ready! No refunds though!
paul: There are new items on the shelves. I was only gone for an hour. He works fast. Terrifyingly fast.
I told myself I wouldn't come back in here. And yet here I am. Staring at Carl's trophy wall. Again.

carl: Welcome back to my quarters! I updated the diary! Today's entry is a real page-turner! Several pages, actually!
I redecorated a little! New curtains! I made them myself! From very soft material! Don't ask what material!
paul: The diary has new entries since I was here last. He writes in real time. Documenting everything. Including my visits.
He's added a new map to the wall. It has MORE Xs than before. He's been busy.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The lighthouse. If I can get the beacon working, someone might see it.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: I should check the cave. Carl's 'collection' might explain how long he's been at this.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The ghost ship has to have clues. Carl keeps a captain's log — he's thorough about documentation.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The crow's nest might give me a better view of the island. I need to understand the full scope of this.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: Carl's quarters will have his plans. He documents everything. Every horrible thing, written down like a recipe.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The jungle path leads somewhere. The bone markers are pointing deeper inland. Carl wants me to follow them.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: Waves crash against the shore. The sound almost masks the other noises.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: Something moves in the jungle undergrowth. Too large to be a jungle animal.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The ghost ship creaks in the harbor. A lantern swings on the mast.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: A bird takes flight from the treeline. Or something shaped like a bird. It has too many wings.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The ground shifts underfoot. Soft in places it shouldn't be. The island is hiding things just below the surface.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: Carl's humming drifts from somewhere nearby. A sea shanty. The lyrics are original. The subject matter is unspeakable.

carl: The house was just the beginning! A rough draft! THIS is the masterpiece!
Remember when you found the kitchen? You were so dramatic about it.
paul: The house. The basement. I thought THAT was rock bottom.
He started with a kitchen. Now he has an entire ISLAND.

carl: Space was too clinical. Art needs NATURE, Paul! Fresh island air!
The station was good practice. But zero gravity makes sculpting impractical.
paul: The space station crew. The medical bay. The engine room mobile. And now THIS.
Three locations. Three galleries of horror. Each one bigger than the last.
